full_summary:
================

### EZ113-240959 Work Point 3d Remediation Phase 2

#### Solicitation Details
-----------------------------

*   **Solicitation Number:** WS4296675622
*   **Publication Date:** 19 December 2023
*   **Tender Closing Date:** 12 January 2024, 14:00:00 local time

#### Background
--------------

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) invites qualified suppliers to submit a bid for the Work Point 3d Remediation Phase 2 project, located in Esquimalt, British Columbia. This project is the second phase of the remediation efforts following an Invitation to Qualify.

#### Technical Description
---------------------------

The Work Point 3d Remediation Phase 2 project aims to remediate contaminated soil and other environmental hazards at the Work Point site in Esquimalt, British Columbia. This project is a critical step in ensuring the site's environmental rehabilitation and is a prerequisite to the eventual transfer of title for the property.

#### Solicitation Method
-------------------------

This solicitation is conducted via a selective tendering process, where only qualified suppliers are invited to bid. The selection criteria for this solicitation are based on the lowest price.

#### Trade Regulations
------------------------

This solicitation is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA).

#### Delivery Location
----------------------

The project will be undertaken at the Work Point site in Esquimalt, British Columbia.

#### Contracting Entity
----------------------

The contracting entity for this project is the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC).

#### End User Entity
----------------------

The end user entity for this project is the Department of National Defence (DND).

#### Contact Information
-------------------------

For further information, please contact Clara Dumay at (416) 512-1573 or via email at [clara.dumay@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:clara.dumay@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca). 

Note that the original document had some languages translation errors; those were kept as is to better respect the original while still meeting the 400 words limit. This is a rewritten version in a more polished and professional tone. 

Let me know if you have any other requests, or if you need further changes. I'm here to help! 

Looking forward to assisting you further.
